Class: Sprite

sprites/sprite. Sprite

new Sprite(sn, def, x, y, h, opts)

Creates a new sprite object. Note that you shouldn't normally call this constructor directly. Call the factory method spawnSprite instead.

Some parameters or options accept functions. An example of how to pass a random range into any Function/Number parameters would be to bind the rnd function in util/rnd. E.g. 

// Random range between -20 and 20:
var posRange = rnd.bind(rnd,-20,20);
// Fast cached random number set
var fastRand = rnd.fastRand(10,20);

new Sprite(sn,def,
    posRange,posRange,
    0,
    {maxloops:fastRand});
Alternatively of course, you could provide your own custom parameterless number generator and pass it in.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
sn Object Snaps engine ref
def Object The sprite definition to use
x Number X world position. You may also pass a parameterless function that returns a number.
y Number Y world position. You may also pass a parameterless function that returns a number.
h Number Height from the ground. You may also pass a parameterless function that returns a number.
opts Object <optional>
 Optional configuration options. All properties are optional.
id
If you want to be able to find your sprite again
maxloops
How many times should the initial state loop before the sprite is automatically destroyed? Set to 0 or undefined if it does not automatically expire. Can also be a parameterless function that returns a number.
autoRemove
Defaults to true. If set, the sprite will be removed from the scene once it expires. If maxloops is set and it is not removed, it will remain on the final frame.
updates
An array of sprite update plugin instances that will be called with each update of this sprite.
commits
An array of sprite update plugin instances that will be called after all the 'updates' updates are called on each sprite. Think of it as a second phase of updates.
collider
A collider to test for collisions during movement
endCallback
An optional function to call when the sprite is destroyed, i.e. removed from the stage
quantizedHeight
Defaults to false. If you move x,y, and h at the same time and the movement collides, then h will by default be altered by the proportion of the path travelled. If this flag is true, then h will be altered entirely, regardless of the collision.

Members

velocityx

/* Some plugins may manipulate velocity, but it is not directly acted upon by the sprite itself. This is world-space velocity.

velocityy

/* Some plugins may manipulate velocity, but it is not directly acted upon by the sprite itself. This is world-space velocity, so to update a sprite's position based upon it, and in an isometric map, only half of this value should be applied.

Methods

hasState(state) → {Boolean}

Determines whether this sprite has the given fully-qualified (i.e. including extension) state name.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
state String The state of the sprite as specified in its sprite definition.
Returns:
True if it does
Type
Boolean

isActive(now) → {Boolean}

Tests to see if this is an active sprite. Inactive sprites will be destroyed by the engine.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
now Number Current frame timestamp
Returns:
True if active
Type
Boolean

maxDuration() → {Number}

Returns the max duration of the sprite before it automatically expires. This value may change if the state changes. Does not take time already expired into account.
Returns:
The max duration of the current state, or 0 if it will not expire.
Type
Number

move(dx, dy, dh) → {Boolean}

Move a sprite by a given amount, taking collision into account. If there is a collision, the sprite will be moved to the point of collision.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Default Description
dx Number Amount to alter x position
dy Number Amount to alter y position
dh Number <optional>
 0 Amount to alter height
Returns:
True if there was a collision.
Type
Boolean

moveTo(tx, ty, th) → {Boolean}

Move a sprite to a point, taking collision into account. If there is a collision, the sprite will be moved to the point of collision.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
tx Number Target x world position
ty Number Target y world position
th Number <optional>
 Target height
Returns:
True if there was a collision.
Type
Boolean

setDirection(tox, toy)

Sets the direction of the sprite. This is expressed as a world position to look towards. This is not used in sprite rendering directly, but can be picked up by plugins. Direction is set automatically if the sprite moves, but you can then override direction by calling this.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
tox Number World X position to orient towards.
toy Number World Y position to orient towards.

setJog(pos)

Sets the position in the current state's animation. E.g. set to 0.5 to place the jog position halfway through the sprite's current animation.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
pos Number A jog position from 0 to 1.

setState(state, ext, epoch) → {Boolean}

Changes the state and extension of this sprite. States in sprite definitions are in the form 'running_ne' where 'running' is the state and 'ne' is the extension. See morphState for an alternative option.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
state String The state of the sprite as specified in its sprite definition.
ext String <optional>
 The state extension to set, or undefined to leave unaltered, or an empty string to clear.
epoch Number <optional>
 If omitted, the state will begin now. Override this by passing in a time in order to skew the animation jog position.
Returns:
true if the state was changed. False if, for example, the state was already the one requested.
Type
Boolean

setState(state, ext)

Changes the state and extension of this sprite. States in sprite definitions are in the form 'running_ne' where 'running' is the state and 'ne' is the extension.

This method differs from setState in that it maintains the animation jog position of the state, e.g. if the sprite was halfway through its running animation in 'running_ne' and you called this method to change to 'running_e' then the animation would start halfway through its new state.

If you had called setState then the new state's animation would have started from the beginning.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
state String The state of the sprite as specified in its sprite definition.
ext String The state extension to set, or undefined.

stateName() → {String}

Finds the current state name, i.e. the state without the extension.
Returns:
The state name
Type
String

vector(out)

Calculates the normalized vector of the sprite's direction.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
out Array An 2-length array that will recieve the xy values of the vector in that order.

vector(x, y, out)

Calculates a normalized vector between the sprite and a given point.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
x Number The X world position of the test point.
y Number The Y world position of the test point.
out Array An 2-length array that will recieve the xy values of the vector in that order.
